metadata.title: CVE-2013-6617 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The salt master in Salt (aka SaltStack) 0.11.0 through 0.17.0 does notproperly drop group privileges, which makes it easier for remote attackersto gain privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6617` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

salt-common - 0.17.1+dfsg-1
salt-master - 0.17.1+dfsg-1
salt-minion - 0.17.1+dfsg-1
salt-ssh - 0.17.1+dfsg-1
salt-syndic - 0.17.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: salt package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.17.1+dfsg-1').
